title: Harissa and yoghurt salmon
description: Harissa is a fiery North African paste and a brilliant store-cupboard staple. Use as a dip, in sauces, or as a marinade.
instructions: Mix the harissa with 1/2 the lemon juice and the yoghurt; season. Chill 1/2 and use the rest to marinate the salmon for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, tip the spinach into a colander and pour over boiling water. Drain, squeezing out any excess water, pat dry on kitchen paper and season.
Use a potato peeler to pare the cucumber into long strips. Mix with the spinach, herbs, and chilli. Toss with 1/2 tbsp oil and the remaining lemon juice; season and set aside.

Heat the remaining 1/2 tbsp oil over a medium heat in a frying pan. Scrape off the excess marinade from the fish. Lay the fillets flesh-side down and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side (cooking time will depend on the thickness of the fillets, so check they're cooked through.
Serve with the spinach and cucumber salad and the reserved harissa yoghurt.
imageDesc: A seared fillet of salmon on a bed of green herbs and vegetables with a pot of harissa yoghurt and a wedge of lemon to the side.
